page.title: 03GEOLOGY SOILS AND CUSTOMS
page.content: The area is chalk with flints covered with Tertiary deposits with alluvium in the valley of the Ver. Hertfordshire Pudding stone which is only found in West Essex, Middx, Beds, Bucks and Herts is a conglomerate of pebbles and clay and there are legends about it, farmers call it Growing Stone because it looks as though it grows from the soil,it is also called Breeding Stone since people believe it is composed of male and female pebbles, and Hag and Witch stone, also it is supposed to ward off evil spirits. The Romans used it as a mill stone. Soils of the area are clay with flints, some chalk and alluvium in the Ver valley. They are naturally acid and in the past the chalk below was excavated and spread to increase the level of Calcium Carbonate.
